Thanks. I wanted to try these chips for hamradio stuff too, so hope to pla=
y with them over the holidays. 
 
 Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFro=
m: w9sz@...: Wed, 28 Nov 2007 22:17:24 -0600Subject: RE: [EV=
P-ITC] RS 12-469 HackII Lives!




It just takes a little time if you under=
stand the basics. All the different devices have their own nuances and pecu=
liarities, advantages and disadvantages. AVR's run faster than PIC's due to=
 architecture, and the code in an AVR for a given routine is generally 3/4 =
to 2/3 the size of a PIC program to do the same thing.The AVR users' slogan=
, BTW, is "Come over to the dark side.":-)ZackOn Wed, 28 Nov 2007, Frank Su=
mption wrote:>> I downloaded a PIC tutorial, but it takes time for old dogs=
 to learn the new stuff.>> Frank-s>>> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: duck=
@...: Wed, 28 Nov 2007 16:55:26 -0700Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] R=
S 12-469 HackII Lives!>>>>>> Frank,>> It can all be done on a single chip. =
I'll work on a proto next week when I get time.>> -Sum>>> ----- Original Me=
ssage -----> From: Frank Sumption> To: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com> Sent: Wedne=
sday, November 28, 2007 4:47 PM> Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] RS 12-469 HackII Li=
ves!>>> Thanks, right now it's just an idea to try to find a solution of no=
 or few radio stations in remote areas, such as the Stanley in Colorado. I =
could still use the white noise transistor, and schmitt trggers to convert =
pulse to random number, the feed a 1 of 10 counter or something. I'm kinda =
behind on digital. I have a PIC chip keyer, but bought it already programme=
d. As wth all of this stuff, I couldn't care less who actually does it. Fra=
nk-S>>> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: w9sz@...: Wed, 28 N=
ov 2007 16:56:26 -0600Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] RS 12-469 HackII Lives!>>> I w=
rote the code for a pseudo-random number generator using a PIC some years a=
go. I'll see if I can dig it up.ZackOn Wed, 28 Nov 2007, Frank Sumption wro=
te:>> Now all we need is a pic chip to output random numbers which can be u=
sed to turn on and off switches that allow fixed tones through to a mixer/a=
mplifier---Instant Spiricom! I'm thinking use op amp square wave generators=
, and switch them in and out using something like the old 4066 chips. The g=
oal being to have a system that works without the presence of radio station=
s, such as remote investigations, and eliminate the concern that we're just=
 creating the messages in our minds trying make sense out of random voice f=
ragments.>> Frank-S>>> Share life as it happens with the new Windows Live. =
Share now!>>>>>>>>> _______________________________________________________=
___> Share life as it happens with the new Windows Live.Download today it's=
 FREE!> http://www.windowslive.com/share.html?ocid=3DTXT_TAGLM_Wave2_sharel=
ife_112007

________
